wxString ConnectForDebug (   ) 
 

public ConnectForDebug Similar to connect. The command sent will put the shell into a sleep after requesting the 'who am i' data. This will go into a wait loop until either the data comes back, or a fail token.

Returns:
wxString Parsed 'who am i' data

Definition at line 260 of file wxssh.cpp.

void OnPlinkOut (  ChameleonProcessEvent &  e  ) 
 

public OnPlinkOut wxSSH should catch XTerm specific escape sequences (coming from the server) The following sequences are useful in this respect: ESC]0;stringBEL -- Set icon name and window title to string ESC]1;stringBEL -- Set icon name to string ESC]2;stringBEL -- Set window title to string (where ESC is escape character (char)27, and BEL is bell character char(7).)

Currently I only catch the first one, and throw it to the bit-bucket. This should probably be expanded to catch all 3. Perhaps it should be integrated more: GTerm has a name variable (I think). I assume these sequences begin and end on the same line.

Parameters:
event ChameleonProcessEvent & Output Event from Networking
Returns:
void
Author:
David Czechowski
Date:
04-22-2004

Definition at line 220 of file wxssh.cpp.

void OnPlinkTerm (  ChameleonProcessEvent &  e  ) 
 

public OnPlinkTerm This would be a surprise. If this happens something likely happened to the network connection, OR the user typed "exit". Either way, I'm no longer connected. An explicit call to Connect would be needed to start another shell again.
